results.title: The Way they live there: an Egyptian village
results.brief_description: Depicts farming methods, irrigation programs, family life, and division of labour in an Egyptian village. Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Way of the world
results.brief_description: Silent film exploring religious themes about a priest who ventures out into the streets amongst the workers to spread the word of god. Cast includes Henry B. Walthall, George Nichols, Florence Barker, Gertrude Claire.

results.title: The Way I see it
results.creator_credit: Jack Denove, Leon S. Gold and Roundtable Productions
results.brief_description: A case study which explores the effect of perceptual differences on supervisor-subordinate relations and on job performance. Looking critically and objectively at both sides the roots of the differences are seen as perceptual. The problem is not resolved.

results.title: The Waters of Coweeta
results.creator_credit: Dick Mosher and United States. Forest Service
results.brief_description: Shows the result of twenty years of research work at the hydrologic laboratory on the Coweeta Experimental Forest in the Natahala Mountains of North Carolina. Illustrates the experiments conducted to define more exactly the damage to water supplies and soil. This was done by creating the conditions of unplanned hillside farming, woodlands grazing, and indiscriminate logging.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Dick Mosher and United States. Forest Service

results.title: The Water trolley (K)
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Penny Spence and Nine Network
results.brief_description: When young Paul’s father is badly hurt in an explosion, his mother calls in the Flying Doctor Service and Paul is left to care for the farm. His immediate concern is to fetch water from a nearby property - a task that becomes fraught with difficulties. Based on a story by Colin Thiele.

results.title: The Water trolley
results.creator_credit: Noel Price, Penny Spence and Nine Network (Australia)
results.brief_description: When Paul’s father is badly hurt, the Royal Flying Doctor service has to be called. Paul is left in charge of the farm and must fetch water from a nearby property. This becomes a task fraught with problems. Based on the novel by Colin Thiele, this is an excellent production from the makers of the award winning children’s dramas, “Danny’s egg” and “Banduk”.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Noel Price, Penny Spence and Nine Network (Australia)
results.description: When Paul’s father is badly hurt, the Royal Flying Doctor service has to be called. Paul is left in charge of the farm and must fetch water from a nearby property. results.title: The Water must go somewhere
results.creator_credit: Graham Chase, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Illustrates the advance-warning techniques associated with flooding. Also shows methods of evacuation, and consequences of not following evacuation orders. Gives some criticism of the practice of building in areas where flooding is inevitable. Uses actual film footage shot during floods in Richmond, New South Wales.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Graham Chase, Malcolm Otton, Roan Hannam and Film Australia
results.description: Illustrates the advance-warning techniques associated with flooding. Also shows methods of evacuation, and consequences of not following evacuation orders. results.title: The Water dwellers
results.creator_credit: Don Murray, Jim Jeffrey, John Hosking and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description:
A study of the people living and working in the Pittwater area 25 miles north of Sydney, New South Wales.
Suitable for upper primary and lower secondary levels.

results.title: The Water cycle. - 2nd ed.
results.creator_credit: Bert Van Bork, American Geological Institute and Encyclopaedia Britannica Films
results.brief_description:
Illustrates the constant exchange of moisture between air, land and sea. Evaporation, condensation, and the effects of the water cycle on the climate and land are closely examined.
Suitable for lower secondary level.
